did.unittitle: Parents United for the D.C. Public Schools records

origination.label: source
origination.corpname: Washington Lawyers' Committee for Civil Rights and Urban Affairs

did.abstract: This collection contains published and unpublished materials such as reports, correspondence, studies, clippings, testimony, financial information, and notebooks, which document the work of Parents United for the D.C. Public Schools from 1980 to 2008. Major topics covered include school conditions, school budgets, school closings, and teacher evaluations and pay. These records were created as part of the organization's work advocating for improvements in the Washington, D.C. public schools.
did.physloc: Materials may be stored off-site, and may require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into five series: Projects, reports, and testimony; Clippings; Fundraising and events; Subject files; and Administrative files.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Parents United for the D.C. Public Schools was an advocacy group formed in 1980 to improve the quality of D.C. public schools. It began as a project of the Washington Lawyers' Committee, a pro bono legal services organization focusing on the needs of the poor, including employment, housing, and quality public education. As the District of Columbia faced a school budget crisis in 1980, the Washington Lawyers' Committee assembled a diverse set of parents from both poor and affluent neighborhoods in the city to form Parents United. Member schools at one point represented all eight wards and a majority of D.C.'s regular public schools.

By testifying before the DC Council and Congress, holding meetings, sponsoring fundraising events, and issuing high-profile reports, the group rallied enough public support to increase the budget for city schools in the early 1980s. They also pressed for increases in teacher salaries, implementation of teacher evaluations, universal pre-kindergarten classes, and improvements in school conditions. The organization continued to testify before the D.C. City Council through 2009.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of the Washington Lawyers' Committee for Civil Rights and Urban Affairs, 2012 (2012.052).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains published and unpublished materials such as reports, correspondence, studies, clippings, testimony, financial information, and notebooks, which document the work of Parents United for the D.C. Public Schools from 1980 to 2008. Major topics covered include school conditions, school budgets, school closings, and teacher evaluations and pay. These records were created as part of the organization's work advocating for improvements in the Washington, D.C. public schools.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

controlaccess.subject: Schools -- Washington (D.C.)
controlaccess.corpname: Washington Lawyers' Committee for Civil Rights and Urban Affairs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains reports, newsletters, written testimonies, surveys, studies, and proposals produced by Parents United for the D.C. Public Schools from 1980 to 2008. Major topics covered include school conditions, school budgets, and teacher evaluations and pay.

did.unittitle: Business and Civic Leader Study of the Fiscal Needs of the D.C. Public Schools
D.C. Public Schools: Where Does the Money Go?
Legal Constraints on Decentralization in the Public School System of the District of Columbia
Parents United Public School Handbook and Honor Roll

Parents United/Washington Parent Group Fund Enrichment Development Project
The Recruitment and Retention of Excellent Teachers for the District of Columbia Public Schools
Recommendations for the Teacher Evaluation System
Survey of School Building Conditions [1 of 2]
Survey of School Building Conditions [2 of 2]
Testimony before the D.C. City Council
Testimony before the D.C. City Council
Washington Parent Group Fund Enrichment Development Program
What Happened to the Teacher Pay Raise

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains clippings of articles about Parents United for the D.C. Public Schools and related school reform topics. They date from 1981 to 2000.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically except for certain files, which are titled and arranged by topic.

did.unittitle: Parents United clippings, reports, and history
Parents United clippings, reports, and history

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by name of event or funder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondence, press releases, photographs, and grant materials documenting fundraising events hosted by Parents United for the D.C. Public Schools and foundations supporting the fundraising goals of the organization. Materials date from 1981 to 1997. Major topics include the Key to the City road race fundraising event and the 10th Anniversary Gala celebrating Parents United's first decade.

did.unittitle: Key to the City permit and sponsors

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondence, reports, testimony, financial materials, data, maps, questionnaires, and transcripts documenting education reform efforts in Washington, D.C. from 1980 to 2001. Major topics include Washington, D.C.'s public schools budget, the Goals 2000 state education plan, school closings, and teacher salaries and evaluations. Unlike materials in the other series in this collection, these materials are not primarily about (or produced by) Parents United, but represent topics of interest to school reformers during this period.

did.unittitle: Citizens for the D.C. Public School Initiative
Citizens Hearing on D.C. School Budget Priorities
Comparative analysis -- D.C. and Montgomery County School Systems
Goals 2000 -- Washington D.C. Community Plan for Educational Improvement
Lawyers' Committee for Civil Rights Under Law financial
Literature on race, class, and schools
Mayor's Advisory Committee on Board of Education Appointments
A Review of Parent Empowered Choice Programs
Transcript -- D.C. Board of Education community meeting
Turner Elementary School parent group fund

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondence, financial information, legal documents, notebooks, and information on Parents United representatives, programs, and services. The material dates from 1980-2004. Primary correspondents include Delabian Rice-Thurston, director of Parents United from 1984 to 2000, and Mary Levy, budget analyst and counsel for Parents United and Washington Lawyers' Committee for Civil Rights. Notebooks contain notes kept by Delabian Rice-Thurston from 1988 through 1997.

did.unittitle: Parents United representatives and member schools
